snippet: The current owner of a 1952 house that Wright built for his son wants to open it up to the public for tours and events.
abstract: Robin Pogrebin Inside Art column; owner Zach Rawling wants to turn 1952 Frank Lloyd Wright house in Phoenix into museum; Phillips auction house hires Anne Freedman, former president of Knoedler & Company, as consultant for contemporary art sale; artist Simon Birch plans multimedia art installation in Manhattan's James A Farley Post Office Building; sculptures by Santiago Calatrava will be installed along Park Avenue median in summer of 2015.

byline.original: By ROBIN POGREBIN and SERGE F. KOVALESKI

lead_paragraph: The current owner of a 1952 house that Wright built for his son wants to open it up to the public for tours and events.

headline.print_headline: A Debate Arises Over Wright House
headline.main: A Debate Arises Over Frank Lloyd Wright House in Phoenix
